page.title: 11Salhouse Post Office
page.content: Salhouse Post Office {____________________ On Friday 5th July we interviewed Pam Tooke at her{Post Office}which is 300 yrs old. It was once a{gig shed}for storing carriages and was also used for{stabling.}A new shop was built onto the original building in 1984. Unlike many of the older buildings in the village, the roof is tiled and has never been thatched.The Post Office is a very friendly place and the villagers always stop to chat to Pam.During holiday periods lots of holidaymakers use the shop. Pam's husband has lived in Salhouse all his life.Pam used to work for a large insurance company in{Norwich}but prefers to work in her Post Office.She likes talking to all her customers but not when they argue with her.
